chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul B. Crocker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Minutes:  14CF1186/15CF324/15CF443/15CF444.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Glinski.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

11CF1186 - plea entered at a previous hrg.

15CF324 - deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  

15CF444 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 2, 3, & 4; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CF443 - dismissed & read-in on State's motion per plea agreement.  

Sentencing arguments heard.  Deft sentenced to 10mos KCJ on each count concurrent with the exception of count 1 on 15CF324 - on this count he is sentenced to 90 days KCJ concurrent.  To commence forthwith.  Huber allowed.  Credit for 53 days.  Costs ordered.  To be paid w/in 30 days.  In default, 20 days on each count concurrent but consecutive to mandatory sentence.  DNA ordered.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $2017.53 jointly/severally w/David Peterson Jr.   Bond to applied towards financial obligations.

Appeal rights.
Final pre-trial on June 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Christopher Glinski. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-3-15 @ 9:45am with 15CF324. Bond continued.

1:19  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Ginski. Clerk LE.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 5-21-15 @ 9:15 am.   $2500.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

MODIFIED
*No Contact w/Margie C, Michael B or their residences
946.49(1)(b) - Felony BJ repeater -  2 cts  /  813.12(4) - Knowingly violate a domestic abuse injunction, repeater

1:50  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody. Clerk LE. Initial appearance adjourned to 5-11-15 @ 1:00pm, with Atty: Christopher Ginski.   $10,000.00 Temporary Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/Margie C, Michael B or their residences
